dpul.title: Exhibits should store the manifest URL they come from
Deleting a resource should delete sidecars associated with it
Link to PDF not showing in performance record

comments.body: The feature was added in https://github.com/pulibrary/dpul/pull/738

The problem is that the field key from figgy is "Electronic locations" but the custom field key in the exhibit was changed to "Program PDF" so it doesn't find the field in custom fields so it doesn't index it.

figgy.title: Run yarn install on production workers
Run yarn install on proc machines during deploy

comments.body:
I did a spike. Things I found:

- [ ] We have to do #5271, #5270, #5269, and #5267. Probably #5268, but I didn't run into that.
- [ ] We have to update Reform to prevent a Rails deprecation message spamming. `valid?` and `validate` APIs changed a little, so we have to fix a couple of tests and the skip validation feature. See https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/commit/46a9d8f8c6946b3c23057b3fd6a6defd47d6b66b and https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/commit/a88a07842fa1925c218141728b7efb6cf0eacd88#diff-362d8fca552a19c801df92b4b8242a2477d22488a2495387e6871fff145d60b1R57. I expect there will be other failures, we'll have to do some QA too.
- [ ] We have to use a branch of Browse Everything to support Rails 6.1. Since we've been on a branch this whole time I did it in yet another branch. I don't think BE 2.x is going to ship: https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/commit/6c2ef4a6e2252070944cdf204b5ad0baddecf012#diff-d09ea66f8227784ff4393d88a19836f321c915ae10031d16c93d67e6283ab55fR16
- [ ] We have to update Datadog - I think we should remove the InstrumentedAdapters, as the API has changed a lot and I couldn't easily find a way to convert it over. Over the years we haven't used those metrics anyways. See https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/commit/93e5f1433bc71b68b7099d2a5def3508ce76715e. Make sure to remove InstrumentedAdapter references from the specs too.
- [ ] We have to run a migration for ActiveStorage, it's done via `rails active_storage:update`. Rubocop will complain about the migrations, we should ignore them.
- [ ] Fixture_file_path is a little different. I think the fix is in rails_helper to set `fixture_file_path` instead of `fixture_file` and then fix the specs that fail to include `/files/` Some of those changes are here: https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/commit/19abc29e53034bd5f16770dcee4b790835de90a2 and here: https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/commit/0c8bda9f9a4a88681871752015e2630c55da511c also https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/commit/1d1bf3ca1dd4b2c70993120083ca02bb8c302319


Alll of that in the trial branch resulted in 10 failing tests. I think we can do everything except the ActiveStorage migration before we actually push to Rails 6.1.

figgy.title: CDL::AutomaticIngester errors sometimes when calling mkdir_p to create the "ingesting" directory.
`target_file` returns nil for characterizing PDF files that are now intermediate_files. TikaFileCharacterizationService
Add original FileSet filename to IIIF Manifest somehow

comments.body:
Hmm. Something to confirm with Conservation. My understanding is:
1.  Collector systems is importing the original file names.
2. Conservation wants their title changes in order/structure managers or edit scanned resource that they did in Figgy itself.
Example: https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/c202f31b-9fab-4203-8251-a202bb343ae0

Do you have an original request or more information from Conservation? If not, could our first step be getting more information before prioritizing?
They're not importing original file names right now, because Figgy isn't providing it. They're importing the label, I believe.
Uh... huh. lemme look at the original files. standby. They should be on the isilon

For instance https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/parent/4b376692-19b6-4f97-a014-18412888a0e8/3e8d0c29-3972-443a-ab57-e5c2d5c758d8 is "20.065_AT.01" in Figgy, but its original filename is 00000001.tif. I guess Melody wants the numbered ones for CollectorSystems?

Yea, it is not clear to me what information is gained here. I would love to learn more, if possible.
![Screen Shot 2022-07-26 at 3 14 55 PM (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45043014/181092793-e41bc942-9b27-48a2-a3cb-60fe88b8cc1d.png)
